result.execSummary:
The defendant Gage W Lewallen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 15CF143 and 15CF105.

miscConds.notes: Paid in full from bonds on file.
Seek and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

Defendant shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with Micayla Cork, Robert Barhyte or Heather Calkins, unless pre-approved in writing by his agent.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Comply with all recommendations of the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gage W Lewallen

records.addlTxt: denying motion to amend JOC
to Amend Judgment of Conviction

Hearing is recorded:
Defendant appears in person in custody with Counsel Travis Satorius.  Assistant District Attorney, Emily Hynek appeared on behalf of the State.  Attorney Satorius states there is a correction of the jail time served and states the periods for an additional 34 days credit.  ADA agrees.  11/3/18 through 11/6/18 and 5/7/2018 through 6/6/18.

ADA Hynek recommends a prison term of 1 year and 2 years extended supervision on all 3 cases to be served concurrent.  15CF105 - 365 days jail credit on 15CF174 & 15CF143 each 93 days credit.  Attorney Satorius is requesting the Court adopt the DOC recommendation of 12 months jail and makes statement to the Court.  Makes update to packet that he currently has one pending case at this time.  He does have a Trempealeau County matter as well.  Court directs counsel to Page 3 of revocation packet for clarification.  Defendant makes statement to the Court.  

Court adopts the recommendation of defense and orders 12 months jail on each case, concurrent.  15CF105 - credit of 365, on 15CF143 & 15CF174 grants 93 days credit each.  Civil judgment for any unpaid costs or fees.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion. Not victim crimes.  Plead guilty to count 2, 15CF105. Count 1, dismissed, but read in for sentence purposes.   15CF143, plead guilty to Count 1.  Counts  2-7 dismissed, but read in for sentence purposes.  15CF174 plead guilty to the sole count.  15CF184, 15CM54 and 16CF28, plus all tracking citations dismissed, but read in for sentence purposes.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the counts he plead to.  Defendant understood. Repeater allegations confirmed.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Felony warnings given.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas. Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty as plead to.  


Joint recommendation for 4 years probation.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA and recommended treatment.  Seek and maintain employment.    No contact Micayla Cork, Robert Barhyte or Heather Calkins.    9 months jail.  No credit for the conditional jail.  Attorney Sebion requested that the contact with Micayla Cork be determined by his agent.  Asks that jail may be served in Eau Claire County.  Start on or before 6/1 at 6 pm.  

Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 4 years probation.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  AODA and recommended treatment. Subject to random testing by his agent.    Comply with all recommendations of agent.   Seek and maintain employment commensure with his treatment needs.    No contact Micayla Cork, Robert Barhyte or Heather Calkins, unless pre-approved in writing by his agent.   15CF105, 9 months jail.  No credit for the conditional jail.  Start on or before 5/15 at 6:00 p.m.  If caught and charged with a crime in the interim, jail to start immediately.    May serve in Eau Claire County.  CC, DNA surcharge and sample.  Apply bonds in file to CC and surcharges.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Sebion.  Court questioned the defendant on his understanding of the waiver of the preliminary hearing.  Defendant stated he understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to a preliminary hearing.
